channel.title: Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio
channel.description:
Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio is and has been for many years one of the most well received Jamaican music online offerings,... but don't take this self publicists word for it; here are some of the comments over on itunes:
by Frutchey2020
I gotta say I love this podcast. Mikey says it's too eurocentric but to be honest we Americans ned more non-American stuff thrown at us. I really love the music, the fake ads, ah just everything about this.
by Ron Dillon
This is, without a doubt, one of the greatest podcasts out there. The music is always terrific and the commentary is personable and friendly, just like the music. Mike plays music that'll bring a smile to your face and make your toes tap.
Carl Maxwell a 2nd generation Jamaican living in Australia
It was not only the quality of the selections you played but what made me fall in love with the podcast,is the delivery of the tunes,because you always show such a love and passion for jamaican music,which I have always identified with.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Reggae,Jamaican Music, Roots, Ska, Rocksteady, Radio, Talk, Information, History

item.title: 113 Bigmikeydread & Phil Etgart - Jamaica Selects Jump Blues Strictly For You
item.description: It was my pleasure to 'interview' Phil for a second sesh and eat more biscuits and fried chicken while discussing Phil Etgart's new compilation another TRIPLE CD compilation a follow up to - 'Jumping the Shuffle Blues', 'Jamaica Selects Jump Blues Strictly For You' Phil a well respected musical sleuth and 'Ultra Collector' created this release as a follow up to the madly succesful shuffle Blues compilation. This show sees another tracklist and discussion of American Shuffle Blues and R&B that was played on the very early Jamaican Sound Systems. before Jamaica's own home grown recording industry was born. This release (and hopefully show on Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio) will be an invaluable guide to this era of Jamaican music. Bigmikeydread Regae Radio was not sponsored in any way to do this show, it is a pleasure to alert listeners to this most excellent of releases... and it was a pleasure to spend more time in Phil's company. 'Jamaica Selects Jump Blues Strictly For You' is on the Fantastic Voyage record label and is available from the 18th June to buy at all good music retailers (including all the major online ones). BUY DIRECT FROM LABEL http://futurenoisemusic.com/ Fantastic Voyage's Website is - www.fantasticvoyagemusic.com DON'T FORGET is you've surfed in and aren't a regular listener to the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Show, then come back for more of the best in Jamaican music, from the past, to the present. Tracklist - All songs come from this Triple CD. Intro, including Rosco Gordon's - No More Doggin' 1.A musical and chatty intro.. 2.Louis Jordon and his Tympani 5 - G.I. Jive 3.A hit in the States does not neccesarily make a hit in Jamaica..exclusivity and affordability. 4.Sherman Williams and his Orchestra - 1,2 &3, 4,5 &6 5.Musical Traces and links, good research, quality inclusions, evidenced sound man shots.. 10 years in the making..hard travails, and the public domain laws.. 6.Hal Singer - Cornbread 7.Honking Tenor instruments...Jamaican Charts, too much production, Coxson's R&B pressing.. nostalgia? 8.Teddy Brannon Orchestra - Strike 1 9.Tracking tunes down, decades of research, Coxson's number 2 tune!! 10.Johnny Blues Boy Perry - Sweep Stake Ticket (Got Good News) 11.Conflicting infor, getting on the right track, working it out, only one 78 of it known,.. 12.Gene Phillips - Slipping and Sliding 13.Race Records? R&B Charts, Blues in Ja?, 14.James Wayne - Please Baby Please (Joe Scugie - Your Lovin' Arms) 15.How do you listen, all day and all night?, links, lineage and learning. 16.Ruth Brown - 5, 10, 15 Hours 17.Release Scheduling and everyone's birthday, the mobile rings with Steve Rice on the line.. 18.Kenny Grahame's Afro Cubists - Bongo Chant 19.Bangarang, Shalit, Decca, Melodisc, Motta pressing and shipping, 20.Harold Burridge / Jimmy Brinkley and his orchestra - Way Down Boogie 21.A gardener from Suffolk? 22.Rocking Brothers - Playboy Hop 23.New Orleans, the Caribbean night and records from territories far and wide.. 24.Vince Monroe - Give It Up 25.Drinking songs?? 26.Gone All Stars - Gee Gee Walk 27.Rock N' Roll, Dimples, more plugging, 13p a tune!! Tactile Ownership Experiences... 28.Roscoe Gordon - Surely I love You 29. Bye Byes, Buy It or buy something else! You can donate to Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio here - http://bigmikeydread.podomatic.com/ look down the right hand side and hit the Paypal button. Your donations are the ONLY funding the show receives and are what keeps it going! - THANK YOU. You can hook up with the show and Mikey at the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Facebook Group - http://www.facebook.com/home.php?sk=group_5364049933 Thanks for listening, and come back soon for the bestest in Jamaican music, chat, sillyness, then and now. - all the best - Mikey And you can read about interesting stuf on Mikey's Blog at - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/

item.title: 112 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - By Public Request and By Popular Demand - The Listeners Select.
item.description: 112 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - By Public Request and By Popular Demand - The Listeners Select... Exclusively selected by listeners to the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show... These tunes, hand picked by the most highly tasteful of all reggae radio show listenerships reflect those tunes brought to the attention of said listenership over time by the ultra selections of Big Mikey himself.. Love and peace to all the crew,,, it's your show, as always, take it away selectors en masse!!! suggesteds are: AT Alesi Poor Man's Cry - Johnny Clarke and When Will Be the End - Leonard Dillon. Luis Bruno - Sad Mood - Ken Parker Eric Donaldson - why don't you stand up and fight for your rights Arthur Schmitt The General Roy tune on the last show, nice toasting ! freeze who goes there by josey wales. dancing on a rainbow by wayne mcarthur. the visit of king selassie by early b. Nathan S Fisk - Gladiators - Other Side Matthew Scott Danny boy on a nylon string guitar Max Waldburg Kunte kinte, the revolutionaries. Oh Mr Dc, Sugar Minott. Truth and Rights, Johnny Osbourne Max Waldburg voice singing something something 'on this little island' to do with a gun?! you can know a rude chap by teh way he set his cap, eh? - viceroys on the pottinger cd! Luis Bruno Don't let me suffer - Gregory Isaacs Ali Sparrow Stop the violence, I believe it was Dan Cornell Max Waldburg anywhere at all girl u got to fling it gimme! Max Waldburg vivian jones, dustbin material - quality tune! It wasn't stop the violence, it was let's start again, stop the violence was on the other half of that show, Mike Quinn Lynn Taitt & The Jets version of "only a smile"... Wicked tune. Max Waldburg that iration steppas- lots wife - tune is epic. Steve Knight Johnny Clarke - Don't Go.......cruisy tuuuune. Joshua Burns ?"Mr Irie" is one of my favorite songs that you played in one of those early riddim podcasts. Also in the "Freshest Selection" podcast, you play Ya-Ho (12") by The Jayes. Not only is it a great tune by you intrigued me when you said something about pirate reggae but you never played more songs like that. Friday at 4:38am via mobile · Like Willo Symons Call of the drums- Johnny and the Attractions. First heard this on the Inna school yard podcast with House of Reggae. Also a song about a policeman who talks about 'sorting out' some bad bloke, I can't remember the names but Babylon Blue rings a bell. Thanks for the add. Friday at 6:00am · Like Michael Murphy Hi Willo, that tune is Babylon Boops... I love and will play it... Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show can do so in a number of jolly olde ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now over 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/. HELP OUT THE SHOW????!!!?!If you want to help out the show, and boy do we need it! You can donate here at podomatic, look to your right, and fine the DONATE PAYPAL button, click it and send whatever you can, much appreciated thank you... In the meantime thank you for listening, it's a pleasure playing music for you, truly it is. Please get in touch, I love all the attention ;-)

item.title: 111 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Rocking Steady
item.description: 111 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Rocking Steady Typically inane ramblings from your dedicated purveyor of free audio to the airwaves. In this episode he begins, he middles and he ends, with mainly, though not exclusively, Rocksteady within. A first at Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio. The tracks are as follows... MACKA B - NEVER PLAYED A 45 ERNEST RANGLIN - FREE FORM FATS DOMINO - SO LONG HENRY BUCKLEY - BEWARE OF ALL THOSE RUDE BOYS THE ETHIOPIANS - AWAKE HOPETON LEWIS - LET ME COME ON HOME HEMSLEY MORRIS - LOVE IS STRANGE LARRY & ALVIN - NO ONE TO GIVE ME LOVE KINGSTONIANS - LOVE IS THE GREATEST SCIENCE DYNAMITES - IF YOU DID LOVE ME HOPETON LEWIS - COOL COLLIE HOPETON LEWIS - THIS POOR BOY HOPETON LEWIS - I DON'T WANT TROUBLE HOPETON LEWIS - ROCKA SHACKA Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show can do so in a number of jolly olde ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now over 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/. You can donate here at podomatic, look to your right, and fine the DONATE PAYPAL button, click it and send whatever you can, much appreciated thank you... item.title: 110 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Come Spar Wid Mi
item.description: No tracklist, just inane ramblings... and Reggae sweet Reggae Music... Ian Cause of house of Reggae joined me in the Shed of Dread to play some tunes and freeze to death, while I, country bwoy to the last, sat respendent in T-shirt, while he suffered in Puffa Jacket.... you caan check mi for no lightweight jumper or insulatory clothing of any description,... I'm coming heavy and loaded with nuff tunes... We enjoyed the night and it's evident from this sedate affair... enjoy, the lemon squeezecake is just to die for (as they say in the more annoying of Restaurants)..

item.title: 109 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - The Winston Sparks Sandwich
item.description: 109 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - The Winston Sparks Sandwich Winston Sparks, aka the Ugly One, aka King Stitt passed away recently, the top Deejay of the 'early period' as I would say, so this show is dedicated to his memory and all tunes sandwiched between two of his best... Hope you enjoy this selection, a top range of styles to make you all smiles... Tracklist King Stitt - Fire Corner Dean Stone and General Roy - I want to hold you girl Junjo Players - Holding Dub Don Angelo - General Freddie McKay and the Aces - A littel bit will do Errol Scorcher - '51 Storm Dennis AlCapone - Master Key Junior Byles - King Of Babylon The Bleechers - What's wrong with you The Wailers - Stir it up M. Samuels - Dreadlocks in the Ark The Wailers - Cheer Up Alfingers - Earth a run red (Richie Spice / Waiting in vain - mash up Alfingers - I believe / Cher / Declaration mix Studio One Players - Sitting With Stupid Flourgon - Hol A Spliff King Stitt - Dance Beat Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show can do so in a number of jolly olde ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now over 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/. HELP OUT THE SHOW????!!!?!If you want to help out the show, and boy do we need it! You can donate here at podomatic, look to your right, and fine the DONATE PAYPAL button, click it and send whatever you can, much appreciated thank you... In the meantime thank you for listening, it's a pleasure playing music for you, truly it is. Please get in touch, I love all the attention ;-)

item.title: 107 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - The Chrimbo Show
item.description: Wotcher, a mainly 12" selection in yer direction, fun for all the family this Christmas. Hope ya'll dig it... item.title: 101 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Calypso Hotel
item.description: Ever listened to that Hotel style Calypso and wished, 'boy I could do with a whole hour of this tacky old rot', yes?? Well you've come to the right place... There's a certain sound to commercially minded Calypso, some of which was being performed for the exotically inclined holiday maker in the 50s and 60s and this 'sound' is what I wanted to get across on this particular show.. I hope I have expressed this adequately? Tracklist - 1.Lord Flea- Shake Senora 2.Foxy Dean and Fred Callenders Calypsonians - Shame and Scandal 3.Hiltonaires - Day-O 4.Hiltonaires - The Monkey 5.Montego Beach Hotel Band - Bloodshot Eyes 6.Harry Belafonte - Man Smart (Woman Smarter) 7.Count Frank - Calypso Island 8.Talbot Brothers - Atomic Nightmare 9.The Barbados Steel Orchestra - House Of The Rising Sun 10.Vincent Martin and Peanuts Taylor - Everybody Sing Whem The Boat Pull Out 11.Ken Kirkham - Go Down To Kingston Market 12.Russ Henderson - West Indian Drums 13.Lord Anticss and the Merry Boys - Woop Wap Man 14.The Mighty Terror with Rupert Nurse's Calypso Band - No Carnival In Britain 15.The Islanders - May Walk (Mango Walk) 16.Andre Touissant - Watermelon Spolin' - Melody 17.Frankie Anderson - Limbo 18.Edmundo Ross - Coclotate, Whiskey and Vanilla Gin Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show can do so in a number of jolly olde ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now over 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/. item.title: 098 Bigmikeydread & Phil Etgart - Jumping the Shuffle Blues
item.description: 098 Bigmikeydread & Phil Etgart - Jumping the Shuffle Blues It was my pleasure to 'interview' and eat biscuits while discussing Phil Etgart's new TRIPLE CD compilation 'Jumping the Shuffle Blues' recently. Phil is a well respected musical sleuth and this release and show sees a compilation of American Shuffle Blues and R&B that was played on Jamaican Sound Systems before Jamaica's own home grown recording industry was born. This release (and hopefully show on Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio) is an invaluable guide to this era of Jamaican music and an extremely pleasurable listen. Bigmikeydread Regae Radio was not sponsored in any way to do this show, it is a pleasure to alert listeners to this most excellent of releases... and was a pleasure to spend more time in Phil's company. JUMPING THE SHUFFLE BLUES is on the Fantastic Voyage record label and is available from the 20th June to buy at all good music retailers (including all the major online ones) NOW! ‘OUT NOW’ ! BUY FROM AMAZON http://www.amazon.co.uk/Jumping-Shuffle-Blues-Jamaican-System/dp/B004ULY6AA/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1308053490&sr=8-1 BUY DIRECT FROM LABEL http://futurenoisemusic.com/product.aspx?id=739 Fantastic Voyage's Website is - www.fantasticvoyagemusic.com DON'T FORGET is you've surfed in and aren't a regular listener to the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Show, then come back for more of the best in Jamaican music, from the past, to the present. Tracklist - All songs come from this Triple CD. Intro, including Rosco Gordon's - No More Doggin' 1.Introducing Phil, and on buying records, Jamaican Sound Systems and musical appreciation. 2.Louis Jordon - Salt Pork, West Virginia 3.Collecting, How many records do you really have? Asberger's Syndrome? 4.Gene Ammons and his Orchestra - Jughead Ramble 5.Where can people get 'Jumping The Shuffle Blues' Cd? How did you get the compilation idea of the ground? 6.Cover Ups, scratched out labels and finding out what the hell that tune is! 7.Teddy Brannon - Mixon with Dixon 8.How did the tunes really get to Jamaica in the first place? And how to sell booze AND music at the same time. 9.Charles Gonzalez - I'm Free 10.A Selector Selects, A Deejay interjects and the Operator pays the cheques. 11.The Bopa-Loos - South Parkway Mambo 12.On Biccies and Tea, Death of the 'imported tune'? And the early artistes and homegrown releases. 13.Bill Doggett - Quaker City 14.Jazz, styles of music played on Sound Systems and 'evidence'. 15.Wynonie Harris - Bloodshot Eyes 16.Sleevenotian, labels who licenced, Fats and American acts in Jamaica live. 17.Dave Bartholomew - Shufflin' Fox 18.Big Maybelle - I Don't Want To Cry 19.More waffle and then another tune.... 20.Zuzu Bollin - Why Don't You Eat Where You Slept Last Night? 21.Lots of tunes... FOR UNDER A TENNER! 22.Gene Coy and his Killer Dillers - Killer Diller 23.Jughead Ramble, Jamaican Musical Munching Machinery and the Crossroads, Biscuit Alarm 24.Hal Paige - Drive It Home 25.Summing Up, Duke Reid, Duke Vin? 26.Big Jay McNeeley - Big Jay Shuffle 27.Outro and a final plug, big hugs and thank yous etc. You can donate to Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio here - http://bigmikeydread.podomatic.com/ look down the right hand side and hit the Paypal button. Your donations are the ONLY funding the show receives and are what keeps it going! - THANK YOU. You can hook up with the show and Mikey at the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Facebook Group - http://www.facebook.com/home.php?sk=group_5364049933 Thanks for listening, and come back soon for the bestest in Jamaican music, chat, sillyness, then and now. - all the best - Mikey And you can read about interesting stuf on Mikey's Blog at - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/

BUY DIRECT FROM LABEL http://futurenoisemusic.com/product.aspx?id=739
Fantastic Voyage's Website is - www.fantasticvoyagemusic.com
DON'T FORGET is you've surfed in and aren't a regular listener to the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Show, then come back for more of the best in Jamaican music, from the past, to the present.
Tracklist - All songs come from this Triple CD.
Intro, including Rosco Gordon's - No More Doggin' 1.Introducing Phil, and on buying records, Jamaican Sound Systems and musical appreciation. 2.Louis Jordon - Salt Pork, West Virginia 3.Collecting, How many records do you really have? Asberger's Syndrome? 4.Gene Ammons and his Orchestra - Jughead Ramble 5.Where can people get 'Jumping The Shuffle Blues' Cd? How did you get the compilation idea of the ground? 6.Cover Ups, scratched out labels and finding out what the hell that tune is! 7.Teddy Brannon - Mixon with Dixon 8.How did the tunes really get to Jamaica in the first place? And how to sell booze AND music at the same time. 9.Charles Gonzalez - I'm Free 10.A Selector Selects, A Deejay interjects and the Operator pays the cheques. 11.The Bopa-Loos - South Parkway Mambo 12.On Biccies and Tea, Death of the 'imported tune'? And the early artistes and homegrown releases. 13.Bill Doggett - Quaker City 14.Jazz, styles of music played on Sound Systems and 'evidence'. 15.Wynonie Harris - Bloodshot Eyes 16.Sleevenotian, labels who licenced, Fats and American acts in Jamaica live. 17.Dave Bartholomew - Shufflin' Fox 18.Big Maybelle - I Don't Want To Cry 19.More waffle and then another tune.... 20.Zuzu Bollin - Why Don't You Eat Where You Slept Last Night? 21.Lots of tunes... FOR UNDER A TENNER! 22.Gene Coy and his Killer Dillers - Killer Diller 23.Jughead Ramble, Jamaican Musical Munching Machinery and the Crossroads, Biscuit Alarm 24.Hal Paige - Drive It Home 25.Summing Up, Duke Reid, Duke Vin? 26.Big Jay McNeeley - Big Jay Shuffle 27.Outro and a final plug, big hugs and thank yous etc.
You can donate to Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio here - http://bigmikeydread.podomatic.com/ look down the right hand side and hit the Paypal button. Your donations are the ONLY funding the show receives and are what keeps it going! - THANK YOU.
You can hook up with the show and Mikey at the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Facebook Group - http://www.facebook.com/home.php?sk=group_5364049933
Thanks for listening, and come back soon for the bestest in Jamaican music, chat, sillyness, then and now. - all the best - Mikey
And you can read about interesting stuf on Mikey's Blog at - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/

item.title: 093 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - House of Reggae Inna Bigmikey Shed Part 2
item.description: CAN YOU STAY AWAKE????????? In Part 2 of this virtual radio expo Mike Murphy & Ian Causer try desperately to impress the Jamaican music cognecenti with a musical spagetti and a splashing dashing sauce. In this 2nd ep of normal service resumptions Mike remains attached to waffle while Ian, concise and to the point, reigns within his naturally retained exuberance. Please take a dip into this musical trip. Happy holidays. Tracklist - 1.Carlton Livingstone - History (Upsetter 12") 2.Zeddie Bailey - Babylon Gone (Fuds 7" Single) 2.1 King Tony - Speak No Evil (Fuds 7") 3.I-Roy - Rootsman (Love 7" Single) 4.Gregory Isaacs - Open The Door To Your Hearts (Cactus 7" Single) 5.I-Roy - Step Right In (Bullet 7" Single) 6.I-Roy - Universal Natty (Well Charge 7" Single) 7.Freddie McKay - Love Is A Treaure (Duke 7" Single) 8.Big Boss - Kung Fu Rock (Afro 7" Single) 9.Pat Kelly - How Long Will It Take (Gas 7" Single) 10.Jeff Barnes - (Jackpot 7" Single) 11.Phyllis Dillon - Woman Of The Ghetto (7" Single) 12.Dennis Alcapone - Funky Tang (7" Single) 13.Prince Jazzbo - Dirty Harry Version (Trojan Lp track) 14.Glen Brown - Dirty Harry (Pantomine 7" Single) 15.Glen Brown - Dance Good (Cactus 7" E.P.) 16.Slim SMith - (Jackpot 7" Single) 17.Bruce Ruffin - Dry Up Your Tears (Beverly's 7" 'Revive' Single) 18.Alton Ellis - Again (7" Single) 19.Freddy McKay - Go On This Way (Moodie 7") 20.Jo Jo Bennett - Ten Steps To Soul (Moodie 7") 21.Ken Parker - Guilty (Jackpot 7") 22.Ken Parker - Guilty (Jackpot 7") 23.Cornell Campbell - Pity The Children (Jackpot 7") 24.Cornell Campbell - Stalawa(t) (Jackpot 7") 25.Cornell Campbell - Make Hay (Randy's 7" Revive) 26.Derrick Morgan - Lover Boy (Blue Beat 7" Single) 27. Derrick & Naomi - Heart Of Stone (Blue Beat 7" Single) 28.Don Drummond - Garden Of Love (Island 7" Single) 29.Laurel Aitken - Baba Kill Me Goat (Kalypso 7" Single) 30.Carl Meeks - Haul and Pull Up Selecter (Photographer 7" Single) Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show can do so in a number of jolly olde ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now over 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/. item.title: 092 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - House of Reggae Inna Bigmikey Shed Part 1
item.description: 092 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - House of Reggae Inna Bigmikey Shed Part 1 You can hook up with Jah Causer on House of Reggae here - http://houseofreggae.podomatic.com/ In Part 1 of this show Mike & Ian hope to delight with a subtle melange of ripe berry fruits combined with a robust vintage musical selection, with just the merest suspicion of a languorous humourous hubris. In this resumption of 'normal' service Mike returns to the Mic dragging Ian kicking and screaming from his London hideaway into the wilds of deepest Sussex to unite in an effort to create nuff vibes... welcome. Join us for this dip into some of music's half shadowed recesses and the world, in particular sounds abound of Jamaican music. Reggae in particular.The show is dedicated to the thousands of Japanese civilians who have suffered and to Smiley Culture latterly of the Saxon Sound System. Tracklist - 1.Dawn Penn - No No No (Studio One Rockers cd on Soul Jazz records) 2.Willie Cobb - You Don't Love Me (Mp3 Download) 3.Percy Sledge - Take Time To Know Her (Atlantic 7" Single) 4.Tinga Stewart & Ninjaman - Take Time To Know Her (Hawkeye 12" Single) 5.Wailers (Bunny Wailer) - Dreamland (Upsetter revive 7" Single) 6.El Tempos - My Dream Island (Mp3 Download) 7.Smiley Culture - Cockney Translation (Fashion 12" Single) 8.Smiley Culture with Asher Senator - It's Coming Down (Top Notch Lp track) 9.Early B - Deejay with Degree (Moa Anbessa 10" Single) 10.Abyssinians - Declaration of Rights (Studio 1 7") 11.Sir Harry - Version on Declaration of Rights(Studio One 7") 12.Cornell Campbell - Watch This Sound (Monica's 7") 13.Leroy Smart - Mother Liza (Fe Me Time 7") 14.Zekiel Parchment and the Jaytels - West Beirut (One Combination 7") 15.Errol Don Mais - Babylon Fight Down Youth Man (12" Single) Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show can do so in a number of jolly olde ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now over 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/. You can donate here at podomatic, look to your right, and fine the DONATE PAYPAL button, click it and send whatever you can, much appreciated thank you... In the meantime thank you for listening, it's a pleasure playing music for you, truly it is. Please get in touch, I love all the attention ;-)

item.title: Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - London Trip
item.description: I'm not posting any tracklisting with this one, though I promised that I would... becuase, well I' just too tired.... Basically, the show has been 'offline' for about 7 weeks while I moved house and got new internet service up and running, while we were offline I put a little something together just to keep the tapes running. The London Trip consists of sounds listened to on a recent'ish visit to the smoke, where I met up with RWMN and Ian's House of Reggae, Clive 'Daddy Bones' and Ben to do a show, and then a couple of tunes and some sounds from Tighten Ups Reggae night in Finsbury Park in January.... It's not the usual show. I'll have something like a normal resumption of service very soon, in the meantime, this is a London Trip...

item.title: 090 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Run Come Call Me
item.description: 090 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Run Come Call Me IT'S A BIGGY!!! - Yowser yowser yowser, yep it's that time a rooney again, with your host and his moist toast, tunes for honeymoons and all kinds of dastardly musical custards. Some blimmin' nice tunes on this show and a lovely little underlying rhythm to the whole show, which I, as someone who has done plenty upon 'nuff, can say, 'I like this', and 'It's nice'. Tracklist - 1.Wynonie Harris - Bloodshot Eyes - Vogue 78rpm single 2.Fats Domino - Walking To New Orleans - London 45rpm single 3.Dave Bartholomew - Monkey Speaks His Mind - from Original Sound Man Shots cd album 4.Smiley Lewis - Shame Shame Shame - Imperial (70s repressing) 45rpm single 5.Shirley and Lee - Bom Bom Lulu - Bump Jump and Jive vol 7. cd album 6.Nina Simone - My Baby Just Cares For Me - 45rpm single, an 80s re-issue on Charley Records 7.Amos Milburn - Chicken Shack Boogie - Alladin 78rpm single 8.Count P's All-Stars - Sand Lane Shuffle - Studio One (Roots) 45rpm single 9.Thurston Harris - Little Bitty Pretty One - Alladin 45rpm single 10.Big Joe Turner - Morning Noon and Night - Atlantic 78rpm single 11.Jiving Juniors - Don't Treat Me Bad - Studio One 45rpm single re-pressing from original stamper 12.Laurel Aitken - Boogie Rock - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 13.Bobby Aitken - Jericho - King Edwards 45rpm re-pressing (Revive) 14.Lloyd Robinson and Rico's Band - Give Me A Chance - Blue Beat 45rpm single 15.Pat & Roxie - The Things That I Do - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 16.Shenley & Annette - Million Dollar Baby - Blue Beat 45rpm single 17.Baba Brooks - Shank I sheck - King Edwards 45rpm re-pressing (Revive) 18.Roy & Paulette - Since You're Gone - Randy's 45rpm single 19.Skatalites - Jones Town Special - King Edwards 45rpm re-pressing (Revive) 20.Roy Panton - Smoke Without Fire - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 21.Lord Tanamo - Night Food Ska - Randy's (Revive) 45rpm single 22.Don Drummond - No More - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 23.Emotions with Tommy McCook and the Supersonics - A Rainbow - Caltone 45rpm single 24. Honey Boy Martin - Dreader Than Dread - Caltone 45rpm single 25.Hopeton Lewis - Testify - Treasure Isle (Revive) 45rpm single 26.Pioneers - Easy Come Easy Go - Beverly's 45rpm single 27.Melodians - Everybody Bawling - Treasure Isle (Revive) 45rpm single 28.U-Roy - Everybody Bawling - Treasure Isle (Revive) 45rpm single 29.Bob Marley & The Wailers - Redder Than Red - Wail N' Soul M (Revive) 45rpm single 30.Bob Marley & The Wailers - Bus Dem Shut - Impact 45rpm (revive) single 31.Peter Tosh (and the Wailers) - Stepping Razor - Intel Diplo 45rpm single 32.Versatiles - Children Are You Ready - Crab 45rpm single 33.Viceroys - Work It - Crab 45rpm single 34.Tennors - Feel So Bad - Crab 45rpm single 35.Winston Shan and the Sheiks - Throw Me Corn - Bullet 45rpm single Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show, can do so in a number of jolly ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now over 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/. Tracklist - 1.Wynonie Harris - Bloodshot Eyes - Vogue 78rpm single 2.Fats Domino - Walking To New Orleans - London 45rpm single 3.Dave Bartholomew - Monkey Speaks His Mind - from Original Sound Man Shots cd album 4.Smiley Lewis - Shame Shame Shame - Imperial (70s repressing) 45rpm single 5.Shirley and Lee - Bom Bom Lulu - Bump Jump and Jive vol 7. cd album 6.Nina Simone - My Baby Just Cares For Me - 45rpm single, an 80s re-issue on Charley Records 7.Amos Milburn - Chicken Shack Boogie - Alladin 78rpm single 8.Count P's All-Stars - Sand Lane Shuffle - Studio One (Roots) 45rpm single 9.Thurston Harris - Little Bitty Pretty One - Alladin 45rpm single 10.Big Joe Turner - Morning Noon and Night - Atlantic 78rpm single 11.Jiving Juniors - Don't Treat Me Bad - Studio One 45rpm single re-pressing from original stamper 12.Laurel Aitken - Boogie Rock - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 13.Bobby Aitken - Jericho - King Edwards 45rpm re-pressing (Revive) 14.Lloyd Robinson and Rico's Band - Give Me A Chance - Blue Beat 45rpm single 15.Pat & Roxie - The Things That I Do - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 16.Shenley & Annette - Million Dollar Baby - Blue Beat 45rpm single 17.Baba Brooks - Shank I sheck - King Edwards 45rpm re-pressing (Revive) 18.Roy & Paulette - Since You're Gone - Randy's 45rpm single 19.Skatalites - Jones Town Special - King Edwards 45rpm re-pressing (Revive) 20.Roy Panton - Smoke Without Fire - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 21.Lord Tanamo - Night Food Ska - Randy's (Revive) 45rpm single 22.Don Drummond - No More - Caribou You'll Never Know, 18 Caribou Ska Selection, cd album 23.Emotions with Tommy McCook and the Supersonics - A Rainbow - Caltone 45rpm single 24. Honey Boy Martin - Dreader Than Dread - Caltone 45rpm single 25.Hopeton Lewis - Testify - Treasure Isle (Revive) 45rpm single 26.Pioneers - Easy Come Easy Go - Beverly's 45rpm single 27.Melodians - Everybody Bawling - Treasure Isle (Revive) 45rpm single 28.U-Roy - Everybody Bawling - Treasure Isle (Revive) 45rpm single 29.Bob Marley & The Wailers - Redder Than Red - Wail N' Soul M (Revive) 45rpm single 30.Bob Marley & The Wailers - Bus Dem Shut - Impact 45rpm (revive) single 31.Peter Tosh (and the Wailers) - Stepping Razor - Intel Diplo 45rpm single 32.Versatiles - Children Are You Ready - Crab 45rpm single 33.Viceroys - Work It - Crab 45rpm single 34.Tennors - Feel So Bad - Crab 45rpm single 35.Winston Shan and the Sheiks - Throw Me Corn - Bullet 45rpm single

item.title: 086 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Mish Mash
item.description: I was wanderin' and I was wonderin' where did it all go, where did all the time go, when I perchanced upon a hatch and through the hatch a light and in the light a box and in the box I found jewels, jewels from the Orient. Jewels that would play sonically upon my disc transporter and so my amigos, my petite amis, my chooomes, I played to my hearts content, I shared my treasures with the World. Please find enclosed a number of songs that may please your ear holes. Tracklist - 1. Don Carlos - Money and Woman 2. Barry Brown - Politician 3. Wailers - Bus Dem Shut Pyaka 4. Well Pleased and Satisfied - News Carrier 5. Joy White - Dread Dub 6. Al Campbell - Feedback 7. Rod Taylor - True History / Dub 8. Twinkle Brothers - Natty Dread Uptown 9. Bunny Wailer - Power Struggle 10.Bunny Wailer - Cease Fire 11.Herbie Carter and the Cables - Happy Time 12.Ernest Wilson - Story Book Children / Dub 13.Cutty Ranks - Blood On The Corner 14.Cutty Ranks - Retreat 15.Cocoa Tea - Magnet To Steel 16.Cocoa Tea - We Do The Killing 17.Errol Dunkley - Don't Come Rush Me No Badness 18.Cocoa Tea - Gather My Sheep Those of you wishing to further your contact with the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio show, can do so in a number of jolly ways, such as joining the Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio Listeners group on Facebook, now nearly 1000 strong - http://www.facebook.com/#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 Or you might like to check out his Musical Blog - http://bigmikeydread.wordpress.com/, if you want to help out the show, and boy do we need it! item.title: 084 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio presents - A Conversation with Phil Etgart
item.description: More of a chat and less of an interview, Bigmikeydread goes to visit Reggae Collector and all round nice chap Phil Etgart. Phil has compiled Lps and collections for record labels, he buys and sells music and has an amazing knowledge that covers all aspects of Jamaican music. Not only that, he owns a tune or two! Topics covered include, the Wailers Rocksteady cut to 'Stepping Razor', Cyril X Diaz's 'Tabu', Maryland Choccy Biscuits, collecting mania, selling on eBay, vintage hi-fi and sound systems, 78s, soul, reggae, r&B, american and jamaican music. Nicky Thomas at Chalk farm, Mento and Calypso, playing live, Tony Rounce, and a whole heap more. Tracklist - 1. Dave and Ansell Collins - Double Barrel 2. Chuck Jackson - If I Didn't Love You 3. Eric Monty Morris - If I Didn't Love You 4. Clue J and the Blues Blasters - Shufflin' Jug 5. Triston Palma - Bad Boys 6. Tubby's - Bad Boys Dub 7. Waylon Jennings - Love Of The Common People 8. Charlie Jackson - I'm Free 9. Count Sticky - Chico Chico 10.Cyril X Diaz - Tabu 11.Stephanie Samuels - Africa 12.Africa Dubwise 13.Wailers - Stepping Razor (Rocksteady Cut) 14.Lord Power - Penny Reel ****Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio only exists because of it's listeners help.***** Donations are what keeps the music pumping and the people jumping, so if you can help, please do. You can do that by getting along to the podomatic homepage and looking down the right hand side of the page, see that Donation Button? Go get it!! There are over 850 fans of this show on it's Facebook group, so get along to http://www.facebook.com/home.php?#!/group.php?gid=5364049933 and join in the merriment! Becoming a fan / Follower of the show also helps get it out to more people. It only takes seconds.... Don't forget you can find me on FACEBOOK and on Myspace, and if you want friends to find the show, just tell them to type 'Bigmikeydread' into Google and click the link to my podomatic page....

item.title: 081 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Little Mikey Dread's Selection
item.description: Every tune selected by Michael Cavan Murphy (Jnr) age (just under) 3. It's a family affair again here at Murphy towers, with all tunes pulled from the attic shelves by offspring number one. It's quite a selection, Roots, Dancehall, Skinhead all the tunes he loves best! Nearly an hour 50 of the best in Reggae music online! Tracklist - 1. Cassey Man - Girls Love Mi Style 2. Jah Mali - Ghetto Youths 3. Lord Lebby - Danny Boy 4. item.title: 077 Sweet Studio One - Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio
item.description: 077 Sweet Studio One I know I know, not very original, but there's a good reason for another Studio One show! When I first started listening to Jamaican music in any kind of serious manner, I didn't really 'get' Studio One and Sir Coxone Dodd's productions. I don't know why, I just thought they sounded a bit cheap, a little woolly and not overly impressive. My enjoyment of Studio One seems to have co-incided with my growing knowledge and understanding of Jamaican music, and there's a good reason for that. Studio One IS Jamaican music. Simple as that. You don't get more 'Roots' than Studio One, where it all begun.... Tracklist - 1. Roland Alphonso - Four Corners 2. Cedric 'Im Brooks - Glory To Version 3. Cedric 'Im Brooks - Shaft 4. Skatalites with Lester Sterling - Lee Oswald 5. Jiving Juniors? - Don't Treat Me Bad 6. Emile Straker? - Please Be True 7. Freddie McGreggor - Rastaman Camp 8. Burning Spear - Foggy Road 9. Pablove Black - High Locks 10. Winston Francis - Let's Go To Zion 11. Willie Williams - Armagiddeon Time 12. The Bassies - Things Come Up To Bump 13. Wailing Souls - Things and Time 14. Bongo Man - Marcus Garvey 15. The wailers - Diamond Baby 15. Silvertones - Joke Was On Me 16. Mash Up (Sam Cooke) - Little Things You Do 17. Horace Andy - I May Never See My Baby 18. item.title: 074 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio - Put A Little Effort In Your Dub!
item.description: There are a few Dub albums that the Dub-heads want and 'Dub A Dance' is one of them. It's created from rhythms laid down and used for Effort the Lp from Junior Delgado, indeed the Lp is produced by Dennis Brown and Jux, the Dub Lp also. Enjoy this rare chance not only to hear one rare to hear Lp, but another alongside it as Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio plays the vocal versions to the Dub versions, in the order of the original Dub A Dance Lp. item.title: 066 Bigmikeydread Reggae Radio presents The Steve Barrow Special - Part 2
item.description: He's even recorded a toilet for Lee 'Scratch' Perry! If you want to know more about the Reggae scene in London from the 60s through to the present, or an insight into record label runnings from the 70s onwards, then this may make for essential listening. Steve wrote for Black Echoes in the 1970s, ran his own record stores, compiled records for Island, Trojan, and later his own label Blood and Fire records. He co-wrote the Rough Guide To Reggae, a bible for all Jamaican music fans. Amongst his close friends are people like Bunny Lee, Dennis Alcapone, Glen Brown, Lopez Walker, U-Roy and Trinity. I had the honour of travelling up country to join Steve and his partner Sue at their house in Forest Gate, London, for an afternoon of chat, record playing, tea and biscuits. The ensuing interview spread over 4 hours of recording and will be presented in a number of parts for you to listen to. This is the final part, part 2.
